meanings.sent1: The bright colors on the walls were distractive to the students.

meanings.definition: Tending to distract or divert attention.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object on the desk was distractive to the curious child.
meanings.sent2: The moving shadows outside the window were distractive to the cat.
meanings.sent3: The funny clown was distractive, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The bright billboard was distractive, stealing focus from the main street.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of fresh cookies was distractive, making it hard to concentrate on work.
